instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-02020 : 5V on DV, 20V on charger, no power
threads.message:
Hi,

I got an M1 Macbook (820-02020) with some strange behaviour.
It suffered from liduid damage around UF400, Touchpad connector, LP9000 and CP870.
I removed shorted Cap CL053 and replaced UF400.

Behavior if DC only plugged:
Taking 5.23V, 0.12A (somtimes jumps up to 0.6A for a second).
PPBUS_AON is quickly pulsing to between 0V and 12.3V.
PP3V8AON_PH1-3 stable 3.8V
Most other rails are pulsing.

If I connect the battery I got stable rail voltages and 20V, 0.13A on USB-C.
PP1V8_AWAKE: 1.79V
PP1V8_S2: 1.79V
PP1V2_S2: 1.2V
PP1V25_S2: 2.8V (too high?!)
PP1V8_AON: 1.8V
PP1V2_AWAKE_PLL: 1.2V
PP0V8_AWAKE: 0.8V
PP1V25_AWAKE: 2.8V (also too high).
PP2V5_AWAKE_NAND: 2.6V
PPVDD_PCPU_AWAKE: 0.73V
PPVDD_GPU_AWAKE: 0V
PPVDD_CPU_SRAM_AWAKE: 0.85V
PPVDD_ECPU_AWAKE: 0.73V

I cant get it to DFU mode (even with battery connected). Maybe because of PP1V25_AWAKE too high?

threads.title: 820-02020 : 5V on DV, 20V on charger, no power
threads.message: Ok, after removing UE501 (there was some corrosion on it I didn't see) the 1V25 rails are normal and I got 20V, 0.22A and stable PPBUS_AON on DC power.

threads.title: 820-02020 : 5V on DV, 20V on charger, no power
threads.message:
Did you try DFU again?

Strange to get steady 3V8_AON with pulsing PPBUS_AON before...

threads.title: 820-02020 : 5V on DV, 20V on charger, no power
threads.message: yes i tried dfu again but it does not work...

threads.title: 820-02020 : 5V on DV, 20V on charger, no power
threads.message:
Did you follow all the steps from DFU tutorial?

Try forcing the board in DFU with SV004/5.
Solder RV005 first, if not present.

threads.title: 820-02020 : 5V on DV, 20V on charger, no power
threads.message: Forcing th board in DFU worked. Maybe the keyboard is defective. But unforunately I can neither restore nor repair. It throws an "No such directory or file (NSPOSIXErrorDomain)" error...

threads.title: 820-02020 : 5V on DV, 20V on charger, no power
threads.message: Possibly bad SSD, damaged by liquid spill...

threads.title: 820-02020 : 5V on DV, 20V on charger, no power
threads.message: Okay bad luck for me, thank you for your help :)
